intro: Elettariopsis kandariensis, commonly known as the Kandari sandalwood, is a rare and endemic species native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments within dense forest undergrowth. Its wood is highly valued for its aromatic properties and is used in traditional crafts and incense. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered a threatened species.
